docTitle.titlePart:
Metall-rr-Komplexe von Benzolderivaten, XIII [1]
Bis(methylthio-/-benzol)chrom(0)
Darstellung und Einsatz als zweizähniger Chelatligand

front.note:
Metal-Ti Complexes of Benzene Derivatives, XIII [1]
Bis(methylthio-?7-benzene)chromium(0)
Preparation and Function as a Bidentate Chelating Ligand
front.keyword:
Thioanisole Sandwich Complexes, X H NMR Spectra, 13 C NMR Spectra, ESR Spectra,
Coordination Chemistry
front.div:
The thioanisole-^-complexes (methylthio-7j-benzene)-(Tj-benzene)-chromium (2) and
bis(methylthio-?7-benzene)chromium (3) have been prepared via lithiation of bis(?7-benzene)-
chromium and consecutive reaction with dimethyldisulfide. X H NMR and 13 C NMR spectra
of 2 and 3 as well as ESR-spectra of the corresponding radical cations 2+ and 3t were
recorded and analyzed. In contrast to C(i7-arene)-Si and C(f/.arene)-P bonds, C(j/.arene)-S bonds
are stable to solvolysis.
With (norbornadiene)tetracarbonylmolybdenum, 3 readily forms [bis(methylthio-jj-
benzene)chromium]tetracarbonylmolybdenum (6) wherein 3 functions as a chelating
ligand. X H and 13 C NMR evidence suggests, that at room temperature 6 undergoes rapid
conformational interconversions.
